New York Takes More Police Cases to Trial The city, seeking to curb frivolous lawsuits, is settling fewer federal civil-rights cases against officers By @coryramey Feb. 27, 2017 6:02 p.m. ET 
When Robert Milton was arrested in Queens’ Far Rockaway neighborhood, he said a police officer pistol-whipped his face and bashed his head into the cement. Mr. Milton sued the officer, asking for $2 million in damages “for the excessive force and police brutality.” 
In the past, New York City likely would have settled with Mr. Milton, 52 years old, who was convicted of robbery and bribing a witness after he was arrested in 2012. ... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
